decks.notes: The deck aims to disrupt opponent's plays while applying pressure with efficient creatures and removal spells. It combines aggressive threats like Ragavan and Phage with disruption from Teferi and Phelia to control the game. Using cards like Strix Serenade and Solitude for removal, the deck looks to slow down the opponent's game plan. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Consign to Memory provide additional versatility and card advantage. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

This deck revolves around using a combination of creatures and spells to generate mana and disrupt the opponent, ultimately leading to a powerful combo finish using Goblin Charbelcher. The deck aims to control the game with counterspells and disruption until it can assemble the necessary pieces to win in a single turn. The key strategy is to carefully manage resources and timing to set up the win condition efficiently while preventing the opponent from interfering with the game plan.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of cheap artifacts and aggressive creatures in order to quickly establish a dominating board presence. By utilizing cards that generate additional resources and disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to create a high tempo playstyle that can close out games before the opponent has a chance to recover. The inclusion of cards like Sink into Stupor and Metallic Rebuke allows for additional disruption and control over the game, while cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga provide ramp and consistency to ensure a strong start.

This deck focuses on deploying low-cost creatures with evasion and proactive spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to churn through the deck, the player can consistently apply pressure and close out games before the opponent can stabilize. With a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to establish their own game plan. The mana base is streamlined to support the low curve and ensure consistent access to the needed colors.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. Utilizing Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory for additional combat tricks and buffs. The inclusion of Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury adds a powerful late-game threat. The deck also includes disruption elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy while providing access to different colors for versatility.

The deck focuses on utilizing Birthing Ritual and other ramp spells to quickly cast powerful and disruptive creatures, aiming to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It features a mix of creatures with powerful enters-the-battlefield effects and disruptive spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Wan Shi Tong, Librarian and other card draw effects helps maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outvalue the opponent with its efficient creature plays and disruption.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on early aggression and tempo plays, using cheap and efficient spells to quickly build up damage on the opponent. Utilizing prowess creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, alongside burn spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card selection and advantage, while Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter offer additional creature removal and disruption. The deck's efficient mana base aims to maximize consistency and speed in executing its game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to stall and control the opponent's board while building up enough mana to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny. The deck utilizes the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of colorless mana quickly, allowing the player to cast game-changing spells like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. By disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal, while establishing an overwhelming board presence with Eldrazi creatures, this deck aims to dominate the late game and secure victory.

This deck focuses on fast aggression through powerful creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Lightning Bolt to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also uses Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to control the opponent's board and protect its own creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of early creature aggression and direct damage spells, with the potential to finish off the opponent quickly before they can establish their own game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By consistently applying pressure with efficient threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding, the deck aims to control the battlefield and win the game before the opponent can mount a defense. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding also allows for additional support and protection for the aggressive strategy of the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of cheap artifacts and small creatures, using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thought Monitor to generate card advantage and maintain pressure. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with interaction like Metallic Rebuke and Sink into Stupor, while utilizing Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts. By combining aggressive plays with disruption and card advantage, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a fast-paced Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Guide of Souls, Ragavan, and Phlage, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional support and buffs to your creatures. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Blood Moon and Thraben Charm. Additionally, Arena of Glory helps to boost the team's attack power. Overall, this deck aims to quickly apply pressure and defeat the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards that disrupt their strategy while also putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude, while also using Thoughtseize to strip important cards from the opponent's hand. Cards like Ephemerate and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional disruption, while creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd quickly close out the game. The deck also has mana fixing and lands that allow for splashing different colors if needed.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures that disrupt the opponent's game plan while also providing card advantage and removal options. By constantly pressuring the opponent with efficient threats like Solitude and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, while also disrupting their hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler, the goal is to control the board and force the opponent into unfavorable positions. The deck also utilizes flickering effects like Ephemerate to generate value from enter-the-battlefield abilities and keep the pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming your opponent with efficient artifact creatures and spells. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to accelerate your mana, as well as Urza's Saga to create powerful constructs, you can apply early pressure and disrupt your opponent's strategy. With the ability to control the board through cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke, while also generating card advantage with Thoughtcast, this deck aims to close out games quickly through aggressive plays and efficient resource management.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with the use of Birthing Ritual and utilizing the Simic color combination to play powerful creatures and disruptive spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and efficient removal spells like Dismember. Additionally, the deck employs card advantage engines like Coiling Oracle and Shardless Agent to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of countermagic like Force of Negation and disruption spells like Subtlety allows the deck to control the pace of the game and secure victory.
